context.p: Use the Create XLIFF File section to generate an XLIFF file from a selected document.

step.cmd: Click on the Create XLIFF tab.
Type the name and location of the document to convert to XLIFF in the Source File text box or click the Browse... button next to it to select a document from the file system.
step.info: If you use the Browse... button to select a file, the program will try to automatically guess its file type and character set.

step.cmd: Select the language of the document to convert using the Source Language drop-down list.
Optionally, select the language of the translated document using the Target Language drop-down list.
Select or adjust the type of source document using the File Type drop-down list.
Select or adjust the character set of the source document using the Character Set drop-down list.
Select the Generate XLIFF 2.0 check box if you want to generate XLIFF 2.0.
step.info: By default the program generates XLIFF 1.2.

step.cmd: Select the Paragraph Segmentation check box if you want source text to be segmented at paragraph level.
step.info: The program uses sentence-level segmentation by default. You can select the default SRX file used for segmentation in the Settings dialog.

step.cmd: Select the Embed Skeleton option if you want the skeleton file to be inserted in the generated XLIFF.
step.info: The program generates a separated skeleton file in the folder defined in Settings dialog. An embedded skeleton allows merging the XLIFF file in any computer, not just the one where the XLIFF was generated.

taskbody.result: The program will generate an XLIFF file and the corresponding skeleton.
